 Content is initialized to a copy of the string formed by the null-terminated character sequence (C string) pointed by s.
 String (const char *str, size_t n)
 Content is initialized to a copy of the string formed by the first n characters in the array of characters pointed by s.
 String (size_t n, char ch)
 Content is initialized as a string formed by a repetition of character c, n times.
 String (const String &str, size_t pos, size_t n=String::npos)
 Content is initialized to a copy of a substring of str. The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position pos and takes up to n characters (it takes less than n if the end of str is reached before).

Detailed Description

std::string wrapper.

Use this string if you have problem with operating memory fragmentation. This string allocate memory by 32 bytes blocks.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

mt::String::String (  )  [inline]

Definition at line 189 of file String.h.

mt::String::String ( const char *  str  )  [inline]

Content is initialized to a copy of the string formed by the null-terminated character sequence (C string) pointed by s.

The length of the caracter sequence is determined by the first occurrence of a null character (as determined by traits.length(s)).

size_t  pos,
size_t  n = String::npos

Content is initialized to a copy of a substring of str. The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position pos and takes up to n characters (it takes less than n if the end of str is reached before).

Definition at line 328 of file String.h.

String & mt::String::append ( const String &  str,
size_t  pos,
size_t  n 
) [inline]

Appends a copy of a substring of str.

The substring is the portion of str that begins at the character position pos and takes up to n characters (it takes less than n if the end of string is reached before). If the position passed is past the end of str, an std::out_of_range exception is thrown.

void mt::String::clear (  )  [inline]

The string content is set to an empty string, erasing any previous content and thus leaving its size at 0 characters.

Definition at line 352 of file String.h.

int32_t mt::String::compare ( const String &  str  )  const [inline]

Compares the content of this object to the content of a comparing string str.

Returns:
0 if the compared characters sequences are equal, otherwise a number different from 0 is returned, with its sign indicating whether the object is considered greater than the comparing string passed as parameter (positive sign), or smaller (negative sign).

Definition at line 303 of file String.h.

size_t mt::String::find ( const char *  find_str,
size_t  pos = 0 
) const [inline]

Searches the string for the content specified in find_str and returns the position of the first occurrence in the string.

Parameters:
pos Position of the first character in the string to be taken into consideration for possible matches. A value of 0 means that the entire string is considered.
Returns:
The position of the first occurrence in the string of the searched content. If the content is not found, the member value npos is returned.

Definition at line 344 of file String.h.

String & mt::String::replace ( size_t  pos,
size_t  n,
const char *  str 
) [inline]

Replaces a section of the current string by some other content determined by the arguments passed.

Parameters:
pos Position within the string of the first character of the section to be replaced. Notice that the first position has a value of 0, not 1. If the position passed is past the end of the string, an out_of_range exception is thrown.
n Length of the section to be replaced within the string. If this is longer than the actual length of the string, the function replaces the entire section between pos and the end of the string.
str Array with a sequence of characters.
Returns:
*this

Definition at line 276 of file String.h.

String & mt::String::replace ( size_t  pos,
size_t  n,
const String &  str 
) [inline]

Replaces a section of the current string by some other content determined by the arguments passed.

Parameters:
pos Position within the string of the first character of the section to be replaced. Notice that the first position has a value of 0, not 1. If the position passed is past the end of the string, an out_of_range exception is thrown.
n Length of the section to be replaced within the string. If this is longer than the actual length of the string, the function replaces the entire section between pos and the end of the string.
str Another object of class mt::String whose content is entirely or partially used as the replacement.
Returns:
*this

Definition at line 47 of file String.h.

String mt::String::substr ( size_t  pos = 0,
size_t  n = String::npos 
) const [inline]

Returns a string object with its contents initialized to a substring of the current object.

This substring is the character sequence that starts at character position pos and has a length of n characters.

Change content of the string to upper register.
